title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4254.6 - Fees and Costs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4254.6 - Fees and Costs

State Regulations
(a) The
corporation may negotiate reasonable management fees, promotes
(
e.g., distributions when certain financial return benchmarks
are achieved such as internal rate of return, return on investment, return on
earnings, etc.), share of return and other fees and charges with respect to
applicants, beneficiary companies, investment entities and investment
professionals and firms. The costs and expenses of the corporation for its
implementation and administration of the fund shall be paid from fund monies or
such other monies that shall be available to the corporation. (b) The corporation may also impose fees, including without limitation, application fees, processing fees, fees in
connection with processing and evaluation of submissions in response to
requests for proposals or other types of solicitations, fees for due diligence
with respect to investments and prospective investments, administrative fees, legal, accounting, and other out-of-pocket fees and expenses of the
corporation, costs and expenses for compliance with applicable laws and
regulations, including environmental review and State and Federal securities
laws. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
4254.6

Adopted, New

York State Register, Volume XXXVI, Issue 22, effective
6/4/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
